trans-unit.source: Common base class and contract for DataSourceProvider objects, which are factories that execute some queries to produce a single object or a list of objects that you can use as binding source objects.
DataSourceProvider is a convenience wrapper around an existing data model; it does not replace any data model.

A data provider does not attempt to condense the complexity and versatility of a data model such as [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ado](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ado-md.md)] into one single object with a few properties.
DataSourceProvider is an abstract class.
Use one of the derived classes, which are <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> and <xref:System.Windows.Data.ObjectDataProvider>.
The DataSourceProvider is aware of the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] threading and dispatcher model.
It assumes the thread at creation time to be the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] thread.
Events will get marshaled from a worker thread to the UI thread of the application.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider"></xref> class.
This is a protected constructor.

Indicates that initialization of this object is about to begin; no implicit <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh*> occurs until the matched <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.EndInit*> method is called.

When overridden in a derived class, this base class calls this method when <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.InitialLoad*> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh*> has been called.
The base class delays the call if refresh is deferred or initial load is disabled.
**Notes to Implementers:** You can choose to execute the query on the same thread or on a background thread or using `IsAsynchronous`.
When the query is complete, call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.OnQueryFinished%2A> to have the public properties updated.
Gets the underlying data object.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> is used as the source of a binding, this is the resulting binding source object.
A value of type <xref:System.Object> that is the underlying data object.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data*> property has a new value.
**Notes to implementers:** Raise this event when a new data object becomes available on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property.
To be added.
Enters a defer cycle that you can use to change properties of the provider and delay automatic refresh.
The typical usage is to create a `using` scope with this method and then place multiple property changes within the scope.
This delays automatic refresh until the defer cycle is exited.
An <xref:System.IDisposable> object that you can use to dispose of the calling object.
Gets or sets the current <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref> object to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] thread to use.
The current <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref> object to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] thread to use.
By default, this is the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher"></xref> object that is associated with the thread on which this instance was created.

Indicates that the initialization of this object has completed; this causes a <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh*> if no other <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh*> is outstanding.
Gets the error of the last query operation.
A value of type <xref:System.Exception> that is the error of the last query operation, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there was no error.
Starts the initial query to the underlying data model.
The result is returned on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data*> property.
This method is typically called by the binding engine when dependent data bindings are activated.
Set <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.IsInitialLoadEnabled%2A> to `false` to prevent or delay the automatic loading of data.
The InitialLoad method can be called multiple times.
The provider ignores subsequent calls once it is busy executing the initial query; the provider does not restart an already running query when InitialLoad is called again.
When the query finishes successfully, any InitialLoad call still does not re-query data.

The InitialLoad operation is typically asynchronous, a <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event is raised when the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property assumed a new value.
The application calls <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> to cause a refresh of the data.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to prevent or delay the automatic loading of data.

Typically the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> runs its query and sets its <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property the first time it is used by a binding or a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewSource>.
You can omit this step by setting the IsInitialLoadEnabled property to `false`.
In this case, the application must explicitly call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> to cause the provider to obtain its data.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to prevent or delay the automatic loading of data; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether there is an outstanding <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh*> in use.
**Notes to implementers:** To get the best use out of refresh deferral, do not call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> when this property is `true`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if there is an outstanding <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh*> in use; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.PropertyChanged"></xref> event with the provided arguments.
Arguments of the event being raised.
Derived classes call this method to indicate that a query has finished.
This callback can be called from any thread.
This implementation marshals back the result to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] thread before setting any of the public properties and before raising any events.
The data that is the result of the query.
Derived classes call this method to indicate that a query has finished.
This callback can be called from any thread.
This implementation marshals back the result to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] thread before setting any of the public properties and before raising any events.
The data that is the result of the query.
The error that occurred while running the query.
This value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there is no error.
Optional delegate that is used to execute completion work on the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] thread, for example, to set additional properties.
Optional arguments to send as a parameter with the `completionWork` delegate.
Occurs when a property value changes.
To be added.
Initiates a refresh operation to the underlying data model.
The result is returned on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data*> property.

A refresh operation is typically asynchronous, a <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event is raised when the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property assumed a new value.

If the refresh operation fails, the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property is set to `null`; the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Error%2A> property is set with the error exception.
The application can call Refresh while a previous refresh is still underway.
Calling Refresh twice raises the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event twice.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
